title: Quantum Mechanics Principles Quiz
content: Complete the online quiz covering the basic principles of quantum mechanics including superposition, entanglement, and wave-particle duality.

title: Qubit Implementation Research Paper
content: Research and write a 5-page paper on current physical implementations of qubits, comparing at least three different approaches (superconducting circuits, trapped ions, etc.) and analyzing their scalability potential.

title: Quantum Circuit Design Lab
content: Using the Qiskit framework, design and implement quantum circuits that demonstrate basic quantum algorithms. Submit your code and a 2-page analysis of the results.

title: Shor's Algorithm Analysis
content: Analyze the mathematical foundations of Shor's algorithm for integer factorization. Implement a simplified version and discuss its implications for cryptography.

title: Quantum Error Correction Techniques
content: Explore quantum error correction techniques through simulation. Compare the effectiveness of different error correction codes and submit a comprehensive report of your findings.

title: Quantum Machine Learning Project
content: Implement a quantum algorithm for a machine learning task. Compare its performance with classical approaches and present your findings in a 10-minute video presentation and accompanying paper.

title: Final Exam: Quantum Computing Concepts
content: Comprehensive examination covering all course material including quantum mechanics principles, quantum algorithms, physical implementations, error correction, and applications of quantum computing.

title: Ancient Dam Construction Analysis
content: Analyze the structural design and materials used in ancient dam constructions, with particular focus on Yu the Great's flood control systems. Submit a detailed engineering analysis with diagrams.

title: Comparative Study of Irrigation Systems
content: Compare irrigation systems from at least three ancient civilizations, including design elements, water distribution efficiency, and environmental impact. Include technical drawings of key components.

title: Ancient Canal Engineering Lab Report
content: Based on the lab simulations, analyze the hydraulic principles employed in ancient canal systems. Submit calculations of water flow rates, erosion factors, and structural stability analysis.

title: Water Lifting Device Replication Project
content: Design and build a working small-scale model of an ancient water lifting device (e.g., Archimedes screw, noria, shaduf). Document the engineering principles and provide performance metrics.

title: Mesopotamian vs. Chinese Hydraulic Engineering
content: Write a research paper comparing the hydraulic engineering approaches of Mesopotamian and ancient Chinese civilizations, with emphasis on technological innovations and environmental adaptations.

title: Modern Applications of Ancient Hydraulic Principles
content: Identify and analyze three modern engineering applications that utilize principles originally developed in ancient hydraulic systems. Discuss how these principles have evolved and been optimized.

title: Final Project: Comprehensive Hydraulic System Design
content: Design a comprehensive water management system for an ancient city, integrating multiple hydraulic technologies studied throughout the course. Include detailed engineering specifications, materials analysis, and sustainability considerations.

title: Introduction to Medieval Literature
content: Write an essay analyzing the themes and narrative techniques in selected medieval texts, focusing on their historical and cultural contexts.

title: Chemical Reaction Kinetics Lab
content: Conduct experiments on reaction rates and factors affecting chemical kinetics. Submit a comprehensive lab report with data analysis and conclusions.

title: Ethical Case Studies in Leadership
content: Analyze three ethical dilemmas in community leadership settings. Apply ethical frameworks and principles to propose solutions and leadership approaches.

title: Sufism and Western Mysticism
content: Compare and contrast Sufi mystical traditions with Western mysticism, examining philosophical underpinnings, practices, and cultural expressions. Submit a research paper with proper citations.

title: Spacecraft Propulsion Systems Design
content: Design a propulsion system for a specific space mission scenario. Include technical specifications, performance calculations, and justification for design choices.

title: Democracy and Education Policy Analysis
content: Analyze a current educational policy issue through the lens of democratic values and principles. Propose policy modifications that would enhance democratic engagement and equity in education.
